intro: Fumaria agraria var. laxa, commonly known as the laxa fumewort, is a variant of the fumewort species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae, characterized by its delicate, yellowish flowers and slender, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered with fine hairs. The flowers bloom in early summer and are pollinated by insects, contributing to its role in supporting local ecosystems.
